comment: COMPLIANT. Frontmatter verified: title='QMS CLI Requirements Specification', revision_summary='Initial draft' (acceptable for v0.1 per SOP-001 Section 5.1). Document contains 35 requirements across 6 categories (REQ-PERM, REQ-DOC, REQ-WF, REQ-META, REQ-AUDIT, REQ-TASK), all with proper SOP traceability references. No placeholder content found. No typos or formatting issues identified. Structure follows RS template with Purpose, Scope, Requirements, and References sections.

REQ-DOC-006 specifies that checkin from REVIEWED/PRE_REVIEWED/POST_REVIEWED status reverts the document to DRAFT or pre-review state. This behavior is not defined in SOP-001 Section 11.2 (Check-In). The requirement either contradicts SOP-001 or introduces unauthorized functionality. Resolution: (1) Remove REQ-DOC-006 if this behavior is not intended, or (2) Reference the authorizing CR that modifies SOP-001 to define this status reversion behavior. All other requirements verified compliant. Frontmatter verified: title='QMS CLI Requirements Specification', revision_summary='Initial draft' (v0.1 exception applies). No placeholder content found. Formatting consistent throughout.

Document is COMPLIANT. Verified: title field present ('QMS CLI Requirements Specification'), revision_summary present ('Initial draft' - CR ID not required for v0.1 initial creation per SOP-001 Section 5.1). Document structure follows RS template with Purpose, Scope, and Requirements sections. All 35 requirements across 6 categories (PERM, DOC, WF, META, AUDIT, TASK) are clear, testable, and properly trace to SOP-001/SOP-002 where applicable. No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME), typos, or formatting inconsistencies found. REQ-DOC-006 specifies intentional CLI behavior for checkin status reversion - this RS serves as the authoritative specification for CLI behavior.

COMPLIANT. Frontmatter verified: title='QMS CLI Requirements Specification', revision_summary='Initial draft' (acceptable for v0.1 per SOP-001 Section 5.1). Document structure complete with Purpose, Scope, and Requirements sections. 51 requirements specified across 8 categories (SEC, DOC, WF, META, AUDIT, TASK, CFG, QRY). Each requirement has unique ID and verification method. No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX). Formatting consistent throughout. Technical content aligns with SOP-001 and SOP-002 specifications for document control, workflow states, and audit requirements.

NON-COMPLIANT: Two deficiencies identified requiring correction before approval. (1) FRONTMATTER FORMAT: The revision_summary field appears to have a multi-line format issue in YAML. The value spans lines 3-4: 'Remove REQ-QRY-007 (comments visibility restriction) - deferred' followed by continuation '  to future CR'. This should be a properly quoted single-line string or use YAML block scalar syntax. (2) SEQUENTIAL ID GAPS: Requirements REQ-DOC-012 and REQ-TASK-003 are missing from their sequences with no explanation. The revision_summary only mentions REQ-QRY-007 removal. Either restore these requirements, fill with new requirements, or document why these IDs are reserved/removed. Gaps in sequential numbering create audit concerns and suggest incomplete documentation.

COMPLIANT. Frontmatter verified: title='QMS CLI Requirements Specification', revision_summary='CR-028: Initial creation'. All required sections present (Purpose, Scope, System Overview, Requirements 4.1-4.10, Environmental Assumptions). No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX) found. Formatting consistent throughout. ID gaps (REQ-DOC-012, REQ-TASK-003) are acceptable for initial v0.1 draft as these represent requirements never included in the initial specification, not removals from a prior effective version. Requirements are well-structured with unique IDs and testable criteria. Traceability to SDLC-QMS-RTM is established.

REJECTED: Procedural non-conformance. Content changes were made to the document after routing for approval. Specifically, requirement IDs were renumbered to fix consecutive numbering AFTER the document entered IN_APPROVAL status. This constitutes unauthorized modification of approved content. The document must be returned to DRAFT status and proceed through a complete review cycle with the corrected content. Reviewers must verify the actual content that will be approved - approving content that differs from what was reviewed violates the integrity of the review/approval gate.

Review of SDLC-QMS-RS v0.1 - COMPLIANT. Verified: (1) Frontmatter title: 'QMS CLI Requirements Specification'. (2) Frontmatter revision_summary: 'CR-028: Initial creation'. (3) Document structure complete with Sections 1-5 (Purpose, Scope, System Overview, Requirements, Environmental Assumptions). (4) No placeholder content found (XXX match on line 449 is legitimate template syntax documentation in REQ-TEMPLATE-003). (5) Requirement numbering verified consecutive across all 10 categories: REQ-SEC-001 through 008, REQ-DOC-001 through 014, REQ-WF-001 through 015, REQ-META-001 through 004, REQ-AUDIT-001 through 004, REQ-TASK-001 through 004, REQ-CFG-001 through 005, REQ-QRY-001 through 006, REQ-PROMPT-001 through 006, REQ-TEMPLATE-001 through 005. (6) Traceability to CR-028 and SDLC-QMS-RTM established. (7) Formatting consistent throughout. Document is ready for approval routing.
